text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
W&I, Electronic Products and Services Support, Small Business/Self-Employed, Return Preparer Office
Director, Electronic Products and Services Support Wage and Investment Division
Table of Contents
Preparer e-ﬁle Hardship Waiver Requests
This IRM provides Electronic Products and Services Support (EPSS) with pro- cedures for generating and issuing e-File Hardship Waivers.
) Chief of E-ﬁle Provider Program Management is responsible for the ment and delivery of policy and guidance that impacts assistors. (
) Preparer Waiver Request (PWR) (
) Electronic Products and Services Support (EPSS) (
) Internal Revenue Code (IRC) (
) Internal Revenue Manual (IRM) (
) IRC
) states that all tax return preparers who reasonably expect ﬁle or whose ﬁrm reasonably expects to ﬁle, in the aggregate,
or more vidual income tax returns, must ﬁle electronically. Current tax forms the e-ﬁle requirement are Form
, Form
NR,
SR and Form (
) The IRS will waive the electronic ﬁling requirement under certain circum- stances. Preparers must request a waiver using Form
, Preparer Hardship Waiver Request. See IRM
, Form
, Preparer e-ﬁle Hardship Waiver Request. (
) Waiver requests are approved on a case-by-case basis and are valid for a period of one calendar year. (
) If a return preparer meets one of the administrative exemptions shown they do not have to electronically ﬁle, nor should they submit Form
, Preparer e-ﬁle Hardship Waiver Request. (

) The following are administrative exemptions to the e-ﬁle mandate • Preparer Members of Certain Religious Groups - The preparer is a member of a recognized religious group that is conscientiously to ﬁling electronically.
Chief of E-ﬁle Provider Program Management is responsible for the develop- ment and delivery of policy and guidance that impacts assistors.

Electronic Tax • Foreign Preparers without Social Security Numbers - The preparer is ineligible to ﬁle electronically because the IRS does not accept foreign preparers without social security numbers who live and work abroad. • Certain Preparers Ineligible for IRS e-ﬁle - The preparer is ineligible to participate in IRS e-ﬁle due to an IRS sanction. This exemption ends the date the sanction period ends or the date the IRS accepts the preparer into the IRS e-ﬁle program, whichever date occurs ﬁrst. • Exempt Individual Income Tax Returns Due to Preparer’s Difficulties: a. Rejected returns - return rejected for IRS e-ﬁle and the preparer could not resolve the reject condition. b. Forms or Schedules Not Supported by Preparer’s Software Package - The preparer’s e-ﬁle software package does not support a form or schedule attached to the return. c. Other Technological Difficulties - short-term inability to e-ﬁle due to other veriﬁable and documented technological problem. • Exempt Individual Income Tax Returns Due to IRS e-ﬁle Limitations - returns not currently accepted by IRS e-ﬁle (e.g.,
-QFT) or documentation or attachments not accepted electronically. (
) Although administrative exemptions are automatic, if a preparer submits

indicating an Administrative Exemption as the hardship type, process waiver request using the following procedures: a. Search the Preparer Waiver Request (PWR) Database for a prior or current year waiver. • If prior year waiver found, see IRM
, Prior Year Waivers on File. • If current year, see IRM
, Reconsiderations. b. Input all available information from Form

to the PWR Database. ″ ″ c. Select Administrative Exemption as the Hardship Type. d. Update the Comment Field to reﬂect the type of administrative exemption. e. Edit the waiver sequence number on the upper-right corner of Form
, if applicable (e.g., prior year). Note: See an explanation of sequence numbers in IRM
, cessing Form
, Preparer e-ﬁle Hardship Waiver Request. ″ ″ f. The PWR Database will generate Letter
with paragraph na . (
) Form
, Preparer e-ﬁle Hardship Waiver Requests, must be submitted between October
and February
For example, if the preparer is a waiver for calendar year
, the request must be submitted between October
and February
Note: If the due date falls on a weekend or a holiday, the waiver is due on the business day. (
) The Form
and required attachments should be mailed to: Internal Revenue Manual Cat. No.
H

Form

and February
For example, if the preparer is requesting a waiver for calendar year

and February

Form 8944, Preparer e-ﬁle Hardship Waiver Requests, must be submitted between October 1 and February 15. For example, if the preparer is requesting a waiver for calendar year 2023, the request must be submitted between October 1, 2022 and February 15, 2023.
The Form 8944 and required attachments should be mailed to:

Reason for Hardship Waiver Request

Preparer e-ﬁle Hardship Waiver Requests 3.42.20 page 5 Reason for Hardship Waiver Request Required Documentation 1. Two written cost estimates showing the amount a third party will charge the preparer to purchase a computer, software, or software upgrades, or for programming an existing system to produce electronic returns. Economic 2. The estimated net income or average return preparation fee information. 3. An explanation of how the estimated addi- tional costs would cause an economic hardship. Name and location of the disaster, and its impact on the preparer’s ability to electronically ﬁle. Note: Existence of a Covered Disaster Area can Presidential Disaster Area be veriﬁed on the SERP website under IRS Disaster Memos & Declarations by Calen- dar Year. Any documentation available to prove the hardship described on Form 8944, Line 9, and the hard- Other ship’s impact on the preparer’s ability to electronically ﬁle.
on the preparer’s ability to electronically ﬁle. Note: Existence of a Covered Disaster Area can be veriﬁed on the SERP website under IRS Disaster Memos & Declarations by Calen
dar Year.

within

data for the current year into the PWR Database.

Mail the letters within one day of the print date. 3.42.20.6 (1) PWR Database is a system that is used to process and manage Form 8944, (10-01-2016) Preparer e-ﬁle Hardship Waiver Request, for Form 1040, Form 1040-NR, Form Preparer Waiver Request 1040-SR and Form 1041. Based on the information that is entered into the Database waiver input screen, a unique record number is automatically created for each waiver and letters are created, veriﬁed and printed. The system also has a variety of available reports. Preparer e-ﬁle Hardship Waiver Requests 3.42.20 page Form 8944 Line Form 8944 Line PWR Database Field PWR Database Field Number Description Description and Use Presidential Disaster - Use SERP to verify the Presidential Disaster Area. In the PWR comment ﬁeld enter disaster area information. Caution: If disaster is not documented/identiﬁedinLine9,makesurethe“Documentationincludedbox”isnotchecked,andentercomments“Presiden-tialdisasternodocumentation”. Bankruptcy - Documentation supporting claim must be attached. Caution: If no documentation attached, make sure the “Documentation included box” is not checked and in the PWR comment ﬁeld enter “Bankruptcy no documentation”. Other - Documentation must be indicated in Line 9 on the Form 8944 to explain how the hardship will prevent them from ﬁling electronically in the current calendar year. Enter detailed comments in the PWR comment ﬁeld. Refused to Comply - Is identi- ﬁed by statements made on Form 8944 that state the applicant will not comply with the e-ﬁle requirement. In the PWR comment ﬁeld enter, “Refused to Comply without justiﬁcation”. Administrative Exemption - Enter in PWR comment ﬁeld the type of administrative exemption claimed.

Waiver letter codes are shown in IRM 3.42.20.7, Waiver Letters.
3.42 Electronic Tax Administration
) Every preparer who submits a Form
will receive a letter acknowledging the status of the waiver request. The designated lead or manager is respon- Letters sible for generating and printing the letters from the PWR Database. (
) EPSS will Issue Letter
, Preparer e-ﬁle Hardship Waiver Request or Letter
, Preparer e-ﬁle Hardship Waiver Request Denial. (

) To print the letters, select “Preparers Letters and Reports” from the main menu, then select “Letters for Preparers” from the Reports menu. If there are no letters available for printing, a message will be displayed; otherwise, the is created and ready to be displayed. Note: The letter ﬁle should be saved to the user’s hard drive to prevent ﬁle loss in the event of a printer problem. The ﬁle should be deleted immediately after printing is completed. (
) Review the letters for accuracy. The Letter Sent Date and print indicator are automatically updated on the database. (
) Letters must be mailed out within one day of print date. (
) Make a copy of the waiver letter and attach it to Form
prior to ﬁling. (

) To generate a copy of a current year waiver letter, re-verify the letter in order to reprint it. The system will the update the Letter Sent date. Note: This is usually only necessary when a customer claims they did not receive the original letter and requests another copy. (
) Waiver Letters Codes

Every preparer who submits a Form 8944 will receive a letter acknowledging the status of the waiver request. The designated lead or manager is respon- sible for generating and printing the letters from the PWR Database.
EPSS will Issue Letter 4654, Preparer e-ﬁle Hardship Waiver Request or Letter 4655, Preparer e-ﬁle Hardship Waiver Request Denial.
Note: This is usually only necessary when a customer claims they did not receive the original letter and requests another copy.

Code Approval letters a4 Waiver granted – Based on economic hardship information provided. a6 Waiver granted – Waiver accepted. a7 Waiver granted – Based on information provided in Line 9 of Form 8944. a8 Waiver granted - Accepted reconsideration waiver. Code Incomplete/Denial Letters i1 Incomplete – Additional information needed to process the waiver. i2 Reconsideration request is incomplete/missing. d2 Denial - Not a current calendar year. • d3a Denial - Request was not received by the postmark deadline • NO RECONSIDERATION d3b Denial – Reconsideration request was denied because the additional information was not postmarked within 30 days from the date of our original letter. d4 Denial – Did not provide the two required cost estimates.
Denial – Reconsideration request was denied because the additional information was not postmarked within 30 days from the date of our original letter.

Preparer e-ﬁle Hardship Waiver Requests 3.42.20 page 15 Code Approval letters d5 Denial – Request denied based on Section 5.05 of Rev Proc. 2011-15. No software or computer does not constitute an undue hardship. Refused to comply with e-ﬁle re- quirement. d6 Denial – Prior year request d8 Denial – Reconsideration. Additional information provided did not document an undue hardship. d9 Denial - Because the information provided in Line 9 of the Form 8944 does not support an undue hardship or a catastrophic event. • na Administrative exemption • No waiver was needed • Number of documents doesn’t exceed threshold Code Other Letters p1 Interim Letter w1 Withdraw waiver 3.42.20.8 (1) The following reports are available from the Preparer Waiver Request (10-01-2016) Database home page under Preparer Letters and Reports menu: Reports Report Name Report Content Intended Users This report will generate a listing of all letters that are ready to print in PDF format. The report groups the list by status (approved, denied, not needed, etc.). At the same time a ﬁle containing all of the letters will Managers and Managers’ Letters for Preparers be generated. Both are in PDF Delegates format. Note: Once the report is run this will give each letter the current date as the letter date.

Report Name Report Content Intended Users This report will generate a listing of all letters that are ready to print in PDF format. The report groups the list by status (approved, denied, not needed, etc.). At the same time a ﬁle containing all of the letters will Managers and Managers’ Letters for Preparers be generated. Both are in PDF Delegates format. Note: Once the report is run this will give each letter the current date as the letter date.

At the same time a ﬁle containing all of the Interim letters will be generated. Both are in PDF Managers and Managers’ Interim Letters for Preparers format. Delegates Note: Once the report is run this will give each letter the current date as the letter date. This report can be generated as a PDF or Excel ﬁle. This report Managers and Managers’ Preparer Records Not Veriﬁed will display all records that are Delegates waiting to be veriﬁed. This report can be generated as a PDF or Excel ﬁle. This report Managers and Managers’ Age Disposition will display all records that have Delegates been waiting for 7 calendar days and are waiting to be veriﬁed. This report can be generated as a PDF or Excel ﬁle and can be queried by start and end dates. e-ﬁle Hardship Waiver Requests 3.42.20

Report Name Report Content Intended Users This report can be generated as a PDF or Excel ﬁle and can be queried by start and end dates. The report provides waiver Waiver Statistics for Preparers request totals by form type 1040, Managers and Analysts 1041 or Both and by status - Approved, Denied, Incomplete, N/A, Withdrawn, or Interim Letter. This report can be generated as a PDF or Excel ﬁle and can be queried by start and end dates. This is the most detailed of all the reports. It provides a list of all waivers entered with a summary count by hardship type Hardship Type Report at the end. Fields are: Waiver Managers and Analysts Number, Form Type, Date Input, Zip Code, Submission Type, Documentation Included (Y or N), Hardship Type, Approved/ Denied, Software used (Y or N) and an excerpt from the comments. This report can be generated as a PDF or Excel ﬁle. After the due date of the waiver has passed, this report should be run on a regular basis - no less than weekly to ensure there are no waivers awaiting approval. In Managers and Managers’ Postmark Override Report cases were circumstances justify Delegates the approval of the late hardship waiver request, the current postmark can be overridden by the manager/delegate to allow the waiver to be processed as approved. plete, Withdrawn or Interim with subtotals of each).
